title: Why does my ping increase every few patches?
body: Any explaination? A year ago, I was getting 40 MS. Now I'm at about 55. Nothing has changed except the patches.

replies.body: We may need to do a few updates to some of your network settings to make sure League is still able to get a solid connection to our servers. Let's go through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to get those tweaks done. Let me know if you don't see too much of an increase though!

http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/ is not detecting my Javascript is enabled. I know for a fact it is enabled and I even downloaded firefox to be sure it wasn't just chrome. 
I don't get what the issue is. 
This is troubling considering I'm not using a VPN or proxy and have always been on a WIFI network. 

Everything else appears to be in order. The DNS server is, and always has been 8.8.8.8 and the backup at 8.8.4.4.

Edit: installed on my phone.
Came back with "Certain TCP protocols are blocked in outbound traffic", "Some DNS resolvers appear to be down", and the only Major Abnormality is "Your DNS resolver returns IP addresses for names that do not exist" (This is because charter likes to use their own search engine suggesting advertisements relating to the thing that was searched, and I perceive it as normal)

Edit 2:
Just tested in a practice tool game. Ping now fluxuates between 53-65 MS. Plz Help.

Oh wow, yea that's pretty fkin weird if your javascript isn't being detected at all. Since that's probably kind of an issue, and nothing else seems to be helping your ping, let's get you a little more in-depth help from our tech guys. Hit us up in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and we'll be able to dig a lot deeper in this there!
